title: Morrow Batteries raises EUR 100 million in new investment round
notes:
Location:
- The battery cell factory project is located in Arendal, Norway.

Capacity:
- The first phase of the factory, expected to be operational by the end of 2023, will have a capacity to manufacture more than 1 GWh battery cells per year.
- Upon completion of all phases by 2028, the Morrow Gigafactory in Arendal will have an annual production capacity of 43 GWh battery cells.

Investment amounts:
- Morrow has completed a EUR100 million capital raise with Siemens Financial Services, ABB, Nysnø Climate Investments, and Arendals Fossekompani.
- Current shareholders, including the Danish pension fund PKA, NOAH AS, and Agder Energi Invest, also participated in the capital raise.

Project progress:
- The company has completed a capital raise to finance equipment for the first factory, which is expected to be operational by the end of 2023.
- The project is backed by industrial owners, strengthening the company’s relations with important suppliers and future customers.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, with the company in the process of establishing a giga factory in Arendal, Norway.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover the stages of cathode and anode manufacturing, cell fabrication, and module assembly, as it aims to develop and manufacture the world's most cost-effective and sustainable battery cells.

title: Norwegian start-up Morrow Batteries secures €100m investment
notes:
Location:
- The battery production project is located in Arendal, Norway.

Capacity:
- The initial production capacity of the factory is more than 1GWh of battery cells per year. The capacity is expected to increase to 43GWh per year by 2028.

Investment amounts:
- Morrow Batteries has secured €100m in an investment round led by Siemens Financial Services and ABB. Other investors include Nysnø Climate Investments and Arendals Fossekompani, as well as the company’s existing shareholders PKA, NOAH, and Agder Energi Invest.

Project progress:
- The company is currently working to establish the factory in Arendal, Norway. The capital raised will primarily finance equipment for the first factory, with the aim to manufacture the first battery before the end of 2023.

Project type:
- The project involves the construction of a new battery cell factory in Arendal, Norway.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover the stages of cathode and anode manufacturing, cell fabrication, and module assembly.

title: Morrow Batteries to build 32 GWh battery factory in Norway
notes:
Location:
The planned 32 GWh battery cell factory by Morrow Batteries will be built in Eyde Energipark in Arendal, in the southern Norwegian region of Agder. 

Capacity:
The first of the four planned expansion stages, each with 8 GWh, is to be completed in 2024.

Investment amounts:
The investment volume is expected to amount to five billion crowns, equivalent to around 470 million euros. The project is being supported in part by funds from the EU’s Horizon 2020 research program.

Project progress:
Construction is scheduled to begin in 2023, with the first expansion stage planned to be completed in 2024.

Project type:
The project is a new build, with plans for further expansion stages.

Value chain stages:
The facility will initially manufacture cells based on existing technologies, with plans to develop and industrialize new types of lithium-sulfur battery cells in the further expansion stages.

title: Morrow Batteries Raises EUR 100 Million in New Investment Round
notes:

Capacity:

title: A giant leap for Norway as a battery powerhouse
notes:
Location:
- The battery factory project is located in Arendal, southern Norway.

Capacity:
- The factory will have an initial annual production capacity of 1 gigawatt hour (GWh) of battery cells. The total planned capacity after all four construction phases are completed is 43 GWh.

Investment amounts:
- The property investment for the factory is NOK 480 million, with Siva contributing 67% of this amount. Morrow has already ordered production equipment worth more than NOK 1 billion.

Project progress:
- The cornerstone for Battery Factory 1 in Arendal has been laid, marking the beginning of the construction. The factory is part of the overall infrastructure for the industrialization of battery technology and battery production. Morrow will open Norway’s largest battery research center in Grimstad in the first half of 2023.

Project type:
- The project involves the construction of a new battery factory in Arendal.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover multiple stages of the battery manufacturing value chain, including cell fabrication and module assembly.

title: Morrow Batteries Commits To New Factory In Norway
notes:
Location:
- The battery factory project is located in Arendal, southern Norway near the North Sea, within the Eyde Energy Park.

Capacity:
- The construction will take place in 4 stages beginning in 2023, with each stage having the ability to manufacture 8 GWh of batteries annually. A pilot plant will be built first on the site starting later this year.

Investment amounts:
- The total cost of the new factory will be €470 million, with a portion of the investment coming from the EU’s Horizon 2020 research program.

Project progress:
- The agreement with the city of Arendal has been signed, and the construction is planned to begin in 2023, with the factory expected to be completed in 2026.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, with construction planned to take place in 4 stages.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover the manufacturing of conventional lithium-ion battery cells in the first phase, and later modules will focus on "next-generation battery cell technology" such as lithium-sulfur battery cells.

Note: The article does not provide information on subsidies received or the specific stages of the battery production process covered at the facility.
